content:
You have been using esr for years, but the channel name didn't accurately reflect that. Now it does. https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/115.10.2esr/releasenotes/ states it.

Updating 115.10.1, and then to 128, is the correct path.

After Wayne's post, which made little sense to me at first blush, I actually looked at 128. His call was correct but the system actually popped up the next release as 136.0.1 and voila, d/l 5secs., unpack tar 5 secs, start Tbird no problems, back on release. I'm just a sr user, not a sr it guy, so I never noticed the column issue.

content: Thanks David. Will this leave the actual emails untouched?
creator: jimparker1

content: Yes, this is only a display feature. Categories appear in the order ticked. For example, if you tick 'all folders' and then 'favorite folders', all folders will appear on top and favorite folders' below. to change the order, just untick the one on top and then retick it and it will now appear below. If you have multiple accounts, Unified folders is recommended. That will combine the presentation of folders that have the same name in each account (such as inbox, sent), and will show all other folders below under each account name. That ensures all folders are available. If you also tick 'all folders', then all of the folders in unified folders will appear duplicated in all folders.
creator: davidsk

content:
Kedves Csaba!

Közvetlenül ez nem fog menni, de üzenetszűrőkkel be lehet állítani, hogy helyezze át a beérkező leveleket. Mellékeltem egy képet egy ilyen lehetséges szűrőről. A szűrő hozzáadásának folyamata:

  • A menüben: Eszközök -> Üzenetszűrők.
  • Ki kell választani a megfelelő postafiókot a listából
  • Hozzá kell adni egy új szűrőszabályt a képen látható módon (ha még nincs megfelelő helyi mappa, akkor lehet, hogy létre kell hozni előbb egyet)

A képen látható beállítások mellett az összes levelet odarakja, lehet érdemes azt választani, hogy csak a levélszemét keresése után fusson a szűrő, így a levélszemét ott marad az eredeti helyén.

Üdv, Balázs

content:
The correct settings for Orange are:

incoming IMAP server: imap.orange.fr, 993, SSL/TLS, normal password, email address.

outgoing SMTP server: smtp.orange.fr, 465, SSL/TLS, normal password, email address.

You must generate a 3rd-party password and use that in TB in place of the account password.

POP/IMAP access must be enabled in Orange settings.

content:
A couple of things to check as nothing is working.

In Firewall, is Thunderbird set up as an allowed program ? If no then add it as an allowed program.

Have you recently enabled a VPN ? Some people have updated or installed Anti-Virus and it auto enabled a VPN. Many servers do not like VPN as they think you may be a hacker, so they block access. Either switch it off or create a split tunnelling and set up Thunderbird to use it.

content:
It looks like you are taking photos with a camera/phone ? It's not clear that the whole window is shown. It's also very difficult to read if on it's side. To create a screenshot.

  • Press the 'Prt Scr' key on keyboard to capture an image of the entire desktop screen.
  • Open a simple image program like 'Paint'
  • Use 'Ctrl+V' or right click in the Paint program and select 'Paste'.
  • Then save as a jpeg image to a suitable location eg: Desktop
  • In this forum question click on the 'Browse' button, locate image on desktop and click on 'Open' to upload.

It means the window is so big it's not displaying within the screen. AS this window is not like an normal window, you probably cannot move it in order to grab sides to shrink , so you need to reduce the pixel size being used by the laptop. That means increasing the screen resolution.

I do not know what you are currently using, so can you provide some info. In Windows search type : screen resolution Select 'Change the resolution of the display'

creator: mozilla98

content:
Scooter said
Is a separate app needed on Windows to set up an Apple e-mail account in Thunderbird?

Setting up in Thunderbird has specific server settings and it seems - if using an email client - icloud likes you to use 2FA and an app specific password.

How to generate app specific password info: https://support.apple.com/en-gb/102654

When creating a mail account for existing icloud email address: New Account > Email Type in your full name, iCloud email address, and the app-specific passcode that was established. Make sure to select the 'Remember Password' checkbox. Click on 'Continue' Check the following has been set up. Use the 'Configure Manually' button if required. IMAP:

  • Server name: imap.mail.me.com
  • Port: 993
  • Connection SEcurity: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • User name : full icloud email address
  • Password : the app specific password you generated

SMTP

  • Server Name: smtp.mail.me.com
  • Port: 587
  • Connection SEcurity: STARTTLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • User name : full icloud email address
  • Password : the app specific password you generated


If person had MAC and/or Windows - there is an icloud app that can be used in Windows OS which may help.

Did some digging and found the following useful sites: https://support.apple.com/en-gb/102525 https://support.apple.com/en-gb/guide/icloud-windows/welcome/icloud https://support.apple.com/en-gb/guide/icloud-windows/icwa12798053/icloud https://support.apple.com/en-gb/guide/icloud-windows/aside/icwc4a60941e/1.0/icloud/1.0 https://support.apple.com/en-gb/guide/icloud-windows/icwd3c1cca5e/icloud
creator: Toad-Hall

In my version, 128.9.2esr (64bit), just go to the the VIEW tab, then Sort By, and then down almost to the bottom, check UNTHREADED and it will fix that. Hopefully that helps! -S

content: @Scooter: I do not have a Conversations button on the main toolbar, but I was able to add one by customizing it. Well, clicking the Conversations button simply opens the current email's thread (i.e. "conversation") in a new tab. It doesn't affect what the preview pane looks like, though (not in the main window and not in the tab either). In the new tab, clicking on a threads in the list causes multiple emails to be shown in the preview pane.
creator: ugcheleuce

content: @Shawn: Disabling threading disables threading, but it doesn't affect the preview pane. Even with threading disabled (i.e. the message list shows only single emails and no threads), clicking on some emails in the list causes multiple emails to be displayed in the preview pane.
creator: ugcheleuce

content: @Samuel: According to your screen shot you have installed the add-on "Thunderbird Conversations" https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/gmail-conversation-view/ (which has nothing to do with TB's native "Conversation" button). You also have chosen in menu View > Sort by > Threaded as Swan already mentioned. These are your choices. If you don't like the actual view in your preview (message) pane, disable the add-on and/or change your view in the thread pane in "Unthreaded"

content:
Reinstalling the program doesn't affect the separate profile folder, where user data is stored, so unless you either delete the profile folder, or create a new profile, the old 'glitches' reappear.

Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles, to create a new profile. The old profile remains in case you want to transfer things like address books, local mail, from the old to the new. The new profile can also be set as the default when TB is started.

content:
is this "important notice about your thunderbird newsletter subscription" genuine

The site list-manage.com seems to be legitimate. It is primarily associated with Mailchimp, a popular email marketing service. However, what's their relationship with Thunderbird I don't know. Neither do I know to which mailing list you're actually subscribed to.

Like any legitimate service, list-manage.com can be used for spam or phishing by malicious actors.

It's important to be cautious and consider the following:

  • Check the sender's email address: Even if a link goes through list-manage.com, verify the sender's email address to ensure it's from a legitimate source.
  • Be wary of unsolicited emails: If you didn't subscribe to the email list, be cautious about clicking any links, even if they go through list-manage.com.
  • Look for red flags: Watch out for poor grammar, spelling errors, or urgent requests for personal information. These are common signs of phishing attempts.

content:
My suggestion is to switch on the old machine. be sure to install thunderbird from thunderbird.net Once you have migrated to Thunderbird, here are the steps to transfer to new PC:

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there

content:
1. The problem is usually with the logic of the filter. If you share a screenshot, people may be able to help.

2. Whenever a message is deleted in Thunderbird, it should get deleted on the server too. At least in IMAP accounts. I know nothin about POP. You may want to put this query in its own post and see what others say.
